title: Bayt Jibrin
summary: Bayt Jibrin (Arabic: بيت جبرين‎, also transliterated Beit Jibrin; Hebrew: בית גוברין‎, Beit Gubrin), was a Palestinian village located 21 kilometers (13 mi) northwest of the city of Hebron. The village had a total land area of 56,185 dunams or 56.1 km2 (13,900 acres), of which 0.28 km2 (69 acres) were built-up while the rest remained farmland.[3][5]
